hero.content:
Sea Turtle Sanctuary Has Survived 40 Years. Climate Change May Kill It. - The New York Times

Against long odds and initially strong opposition, a pristine marine preserve in the Philippines has thrived for decades under the care of local fishermen.

primary.title: 8 Billion: A World of Infinite Possibilities
primary.description: "More than half of the projected increase in the global population up to 2050 will be concentrated in eight countries: the Democratic Republic of Congo, Egypt, Ethiopia, India, Nigeria, Pakistan, the Philippines and the United Republic of Tanzania."

secondary.title: Filipino baby girl is 'symbolic' 8 billionth person in the world
The school with 18,000 students: educating the Philippines’ booming population | Philippines | The Guardian
Fertility rate of PH women plummets to less than 2 children

carousel.title: Fight Fascism Before It’s Too Late - The Atlantic
carousel.description: If you live in a country where democracy is still intact: Don’t wait. — Maria Ressa

carousel.title: Obesity’s heavy toll: Millions of Filipinos now at greater health risks
carousel.description: MANILA, Philippines — The past two years have been almost at a standstill because of the COVID-19 crisis, but while its economic consequences were evident, most people have not heard of how a “silent epidemic” took its toll on millions of Filipinos.

carousel.title: Beyond the beaches: five unusual experiences in the Philippines
carousel.description: Although famous for its exceptional white-sand beaches and crystalline waters, the archipelago has myriad unique experiences waiting to be discovered beyond the shore.
